thread.title: WestJet to pay for damage to Calgary home after ice from plane crashes through roof | Globalnews.ca
thread.title_full: WestJet to pay for damage to Calgary home after ice from plane crashes through roof | Globalnews.ca

author: Tania Kohut
title: WestJet to pay for damage to Calgary home after ice from plane crashes through roof | Globalnews.ca
text:
February 27, 2017 10:54 am Updated: February 27, 2017 10:57 am WestJet to pay for damage to Calgary home after ice from plane crashes through roof By Tania Kohut National Online Journalist, Breaking News Global News 
The damage inside a Calgary home where ice from a a plane smashed through the ceiling. Globl News / Kim Smith What is this? 
Sponsored content is written by Global News' editorial staff without any editorial influence by the sponsor. If you'd like to learn more... X What is this? 
Sponsored content is written by Global News' without any editorial influence by the sponsor. If you'd like to learn more... - Listen 
WestJet will pay for damages after chunks of ice — believed to have fallen from one of the airline’s planes — smashed through the roof of a Calgary home on Friday. 
READ MORE: Vancouver man finds out another passenger flew under his name on WestJet flight 
“All of a sudden we heard this big bang and all this stuff falling,” Couch, who has lived in the house for 42 years, told Global News. 
The couple found a hole in the ceiling of their hallway. Chunks of ice and debris were found in the basement. 
WATCH: A Calgary family was shocked Friday after a chunk of ice from a plane blew through their roof 
After an inspection, the fire department concluded a piece of ice must have fallen from a plane. 
“Putting all of the pieces together, the only explanation that we have at this time is that it would be a piece of ice from a passing plane,” said Paul LeBlanc, with the Calgary Fire Department. 
“This is the first time in my 36 years of working for the Calgary Fire Department that I’ve ever heard of this happening.” 
Luckily, no one was injured.
